snippet: Foreign citizens now make up most of the clients at large surrogacy agencies in the United States, highlighting a divide between the country and much of the world over fundamental questions on family.
abstract: United States is increasingly drawing affluent couples from around the world who wish to hire surrogate mothers; many large surrogacy agencies in US say international clients provide bulk of their business; traffic highlights divide between country and much of the world over fundamental questions about what constitutes a family, who is considered legal parent and whether paid childbirth is a service or exploitation (Series: Pregnancy For Pay).
lead_paragraph: Foreign citizens now make up most of the clients at large surrogacy agencies in the United States, highlighting a divide between the country and much of the world over fundamental questions on family.

headline.seo: Foreign Couples Heading to America for Surrogate Pregnancies
headline.main: Coming to U.S. for Baby, and Womb to Carry It
headline.print_headline: Coming to U.S. for Baby, and Womb to Carry It
